Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bullet

  • public class Bullet
extends java.lang.Object

    Bullet

    This class is the Bullet class that represents either a pushing away hand fired by the player or a speech bubble fired by a non player A Bullet will either move up or down the screen and has x and y coordinates

    Version 1 - 1 hour, Yujin, May 30th, 2022 Set up the class with its local variables and the constructor. Wrote the get y method, move method, and the draw method Version 2 - 30 minutes, Yujin, June 1st, 2022 Wrote the fire method that sets y coordinate to initial and set x from param Version 3 - 1 hour, Yujin, June 2nd, 2022 Wrote the checkCollision method that will check for collision and move the bullet out of the screen if true. Version 4 - 5 minutes, Yujin, June 8th, 2022 Made the enemy bullets move slower from the speed of 5 to 3.

    Since:
    2022-05-30 ICS4U0 Teacher: Ms. Krasteva

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String[] BAD_COMMENTS
      This array of strings stores all the comments a bad bullet can say
      private java.lang.String comment
      This string variable stores the current comment the bullet says
      private static java.lang.String[] GOOD_COMMENTS
      This array of strings stores all the comments a good bullet can say
      private java.awt.Image img
      This image variable will hold the image of this bullet
      private int t
      This int variable hold the type of the bullet.
      private int x
      This int variable will hold the x coordinate of this bullet
      private int y
      This int variable will hold the y coordinate of this bullet

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bullet(int t)
      This is the constructor class that will create a Bullet object It will take in the type of the bullet and initialize the variables according to it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkCollision(int px)
      This method will take in an x coordinate of a person and check for collision.
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method will draw the bullet on a given graphic
      void fire(int startX)
      This method will set make the bullet's y coordinate go back to the initial location and set the x coordinate according to parameter so that the bullet can be fired again from where the person is
      int getY()
      This method will return the y coordinate of this bullet
      void move()
      This method will make the bullet's coordinate either up or down depending on its type

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bullet

        public Bullet(int t)
        This is the constructor class that will create a Bullet object It will take in the type of the bullet and initialize the variables according to it.
        Parameters:
        t - This is the type of the bullet. 1: pushing hand, 2: good, and 3: bad

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method will draw the bullet on a given graphic
        Parameters:
        g - This is the graphics that we want to draw our bullet on.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        This method will return the y coordinate of this bullet
        Returns:
        This is the y coordinate of this bullet

      • move

        public void move()
        This method will make the bullet's coordinate either up or down depending on its type

      • fire

        public void fire(int startX)
        This method will set make the bullet's y coordinate go back to the initial location and set the x coordinate according to parameter so that the bullet can be fired again from where the person is
        Parameters:
        startX - This is the x coordinate we want the bullet to fire from

      • checkCollision

        public boolean checkCollision(int px)
        This method will take in an x coordinate of a person and check for collision. If the bullet hit the person, the bullet is robed fr screen and method returns true. It is assumed that the y coordinates of the bullet and the person intersect.
        Parameters:
        px - This is the x coordinate of the person we wanna check
        Returns:
        This is whether the bullet hit this person or not
